pageTitle: Duke Opens ACC Play Friday at No. 1 North Carolina - Duke University Blue Devils | Official Athletics Site - GoDuke.com
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {17877=Duke Earns Third Shutout Against Radford The Blue Devils defeated Radford by a 6-0 score Sunday, Sept. 22 to post their third shutout of the 2013 season … The team also shut out Indiana in its season opener, 4-0, and held then-No. 15 Old Dominion scoreless in a 1-0 win Sept. 15 … Duke is tied for first in the ACC and seventh in the nation with an average of 0.38 shutouts per game., 16806=Blazing Off to Strong Start Between the Pipes Redshirt sophomore goalkeeper and Durham, N.C., product Lauren Blazing has guided the Blue Devils to a 6-2 mark, including shutouts against Indiana (Aug. 30) Old Dominion (Sept. 15) and Radford (Sept. 22) … Her .791 save percentage ranks second among all ACC goalkeepers and eighth nationally … She also ranks third among conference goalkeepers in goals against average with a 1.12 clip … Blazing tallied a career-high nine saves in a loss to Northwestern Sept. 20.  , 16125=Heimbach Anchors Back Line Senior defender Paula Heimbach continues to be one of the Blue Devils’ most dependable backs in 2013 … An All-ACC honoree and Longstreth/NFHCA third team All-America selection last fall, Heimbach was tabbed to the Preseason All-ACC squad last month by a vote of the league’s seven head coaches … Heimbach and the Duke defense own three shutouts on the year and currently allow just 1.25 goals per game to rank second in the ACC., 20793=Duke vs. the ACC The Blue Devils are 78-165-4 all-time against teams in their own conference … Duke went 0-5 in ACC action last fall and kicks off its 2013 conference slate against the Tar Heels Friday evening.}
textBeforeTable: Tale of the Tape DURHAM, N.C. – The 13th-ranked Blue Devils kick off ACC play Friday night as they make the short trip to Chapel Hill, N.C., to face top-ranked North Carolina at 6 p.m. at Francis E. Henry Stadium. The squad will then return home Sunday, Sept. 29 to host non-conference foe Longwood in a 1 p.m. contest. UNC Live Stats l UNC Live Video l Longwood Live Stats l Twitter Game 10 No. 13 Duke vs. Longwood Sunday, Sept. 29 l 1 p.m. Durham, N.C. l Williams Field at Jack Katz Stadium Game 9 No. 13 Duke at No. 1 North Carolina Friday, Sept. 27 l 6 p.m. Chapel Hill, N.C. l Francis E. Henry Stadium } title : "Duke Opens ACC Play Friday at No. 1 North Carolina" { var addthis_share = } ui_delay: 200 var addthis_config = {
textAfterTable: North Carolina Series History Duke and the Tar Heels will meet for the 80th time in program history Friday evening … North Carolina holds a 68-10-1 advantage in the series and has won each of the past nine contests between the two schools … The Blue Devils are 5-30 when facing their ACC rival in Chapel Hill … Last year’s meeting saw the Tar Heels earn a 7-3 victory in Durham Sept. 21. Duke vs. the ACC The Blue Devils are 78-165-4 all-time against teams in their own conference … Duke went 0-5 in ACC action last fall and kicks off its 2013 conference slate against the Tar Heels Friday evening. Scouting the Tar Heels Top-ranked North Carolina enters Friday night’s matchup with an 8-0 ledger, including a mark of 1-0 in ACC play … The squad is coming off of a 2-1 win over Virginia in its conference opener Sept. 20 and a 6-0 non-conference victory over VCU Sept. 22 … Heading into the weekend, the Tar Heels rank second in the nation in points per game (14.00), goals per game (5.13), assists per game (3.75) and scoring average (5.13) while leading all Division I teams in scoring margin (4.38) … Sophomore midfielder Nina Notman is second in the ACC in shots per game (4.38) while fellow midfielder Emily Wold is tied for first in the conference in assists per game (1.00) … Sassi Ammer and Shannon Johnson have split time in goal, with Ammer ranking second nationally
